page.title: 15Local History in Lezant
page.content: There are two ancient chapels attached to houses in our survey area and another just outside.At{Landue House} there is an oratory chapel dedicated to{St.Bridget}while in{Lezant}there is{St.Lawrence Chapel}which is part of a house and is at least 500 years old. It may have belonged to{Trewarlett {Manor}which declined in the 16th Century.If the chapel had not already fallen into disuse,it would have been suppressed by the Reformation.It was converted into a cottage and then in the 17th Century the front portion of what is now {St.Lawrence House}was added.The water,which is pure, comes from a "Holy Well" in the orchard.Just outside the survey area is{St.Mary {Magdalene's Chapel}at{Trecarrell Manor perhaps the best preserved example in the country.
